FuncDef:
The isis peer hold-max-cost command sets the maximum holdtime for the largest IS-IS route cost in local Link State PDUs (LSPs).
The undo isis peer hold-max-cost command restores the default configuration. The isis peer hold-max-cost command sets the maximum holdtime for the largest IS-IS route cost in local Link State PDUs (LSPs). The undo isis peer hold-max-cost command restores the default configuration. By default, no maximum holdtime is set for the largest IS-IS route cost in local LSPs.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an IS-IS process, which is used in multi-instance process scenarios.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Sets the maximum holdtime for the largest IS-IS route cost in local LSPs.
The value is an integer ranging from 100 to 1000000, in milliseconds.
